intro: Pycnophyllum tetrastichum, commonly known as the four-stemmed pycnophyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its dense, clustered growth habit and small, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
